result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lewis Odale Houston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lewis Odale Houston appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray appeared by video for Lewis Odale Houston.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Defendant has FOUR CASES in Branch 46: 20CF4250, 20CF4251, 21CF1387, and 22CF1524. Discussion placed on the record. Parties provided an update to the Court. 
Case 22CF1524 - set for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case 20CF4250, 20CF4251, and 21CF1387 - will tag along as Status; however, if the State plans on JOINING ALL CASES for Trial, State must file a JOINDER MOTION by the next hearing. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
Jury Trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 12, 2022; received and filed.

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. 
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in Court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in Court for Lewis Odale Houston.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case re-called. Defendant's other THREE CASES (20CF4250, 20CF4251, 21CF1387) are tagging along for Status. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel is ready to proceed. State provided an update to the Court and requested an adjournment. Defense did not object. Court GRANTED State's request for an adjournment. Court addressed Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial. Court CONVERTED Cash Bail to Signature Bond. 
Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:45 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in Court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in Court for Lewis Odale Houston.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Defendant's other THREE CASES (20CF4250, 20CF4251, 21CF1387) are tagging along for Status. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. State placed NEW GLOBAL OFFER on the record. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar and allow Defense time to review NEW OFFER with Defendant. Parties instructed to appear at 1:30pm.

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in Court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant has FOUR CASES pending in Branch 46: 20CF4250, 20CF4251, 21CF1387, and 22CF1524. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed GLOBAL offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. State reiterated request for Case 22CF1524 to be tried first. Defense did not object. Court granted State's request. Court addressed Demand for Speedy Trial (Cash Bail was NOT posted on Case 22CF1524). No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. 

Court ordered Case 22CF1524 adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
Letter from defendant re:  reducing bail.  (Lewis O. Houston - #2021015793, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in Court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant has FOUR CASES pending in Branch 46: 20CF4250, 20CF4251, 21CF1387, and 22CF1524. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State to provide Defense with jail calls. State failed to file a Joinder Motion by today's date. Defense objected to Joinder. State advised the Court that Case 22CF1524 should be tried first. Parties requested an adjourned Final PreTrial date. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Expires September 8, 2022.

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in Court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty and Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Defendant has FOUR CASES pending in Branch 46: 20CF4250, 20CF4251, 21CF1387, and 22CF1524. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. State advised the Court of JOINDER MOTION. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray; both appear by video.  Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 15CF1019. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Martin. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and granted in part. Court dismisses Counts 3, 4 and 5. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial as to Counts 1 and 2.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in Court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Lewis Odale Houston in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.
Defendant received a copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. 
State addressed scrivener's error -- offense date is April 6, 2021 (not April 6, 2020). Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. 
Defense moved to dismissed to 'Habitual Criminality Repeater' on Count 3, Count 4, and Count 5. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Dismiss 'Habitual Criminality Repeater'. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. 

DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
